verses.kjv: For the LORD will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land: and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.
verses.ct: The LORD will show mercy to Jacob and will once again choose Israel, settling them back in their own land. Foreigners will join them and unite themselves with the house of Jacob.

verses.kjv: And the people shall take them, and bring them to their place: and the house of Israel shall possess them in the land of the LORD for servants and handmaids: and they shall take them captives, whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.
verses.ct: Nations will escort them and bring them home. Then the house of Israel will take possession of those people in the LORD's land as male and female servants. They will capture those who once captured them, and they will rule over those who once oppressed them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the day that the LORD shall give thee rest from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve,
verses.ct: On the day the LORD gives you relief from your suffering, your anxiety, and the brutal slavery you were forced to endure,

verses.kjv: That thou shalt take up this proverb against the king of Babylon, and say, How hath the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!
verses.ct: you will recite this mocking song against the king of Babylon: 'Look how the oppressor has come to an end! His reign of terror is over!'

verses.kjv: The LORD hath broken the staff of the wicked, and the sceptre of the rulers.
verses.ct: The LORD has snapped the rod of the wicked and shattered the scepter of tyrants.

verses.kjv: He who smote the people in wrath with a continual stroke, he that ruled the nations in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.
verses.ct: The one who struck down peoples in fury with relentless blows, who dominated nations in anger — now he is pursued, and no one holds back.

verses.kjv: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into singing.
verses.ct: The entire earth rests peacefully and is calm; everyone bursts into joyful song.

verses.kjv: Yea, the fir trees rejoice at thee, and the cedars of Lebanon, saying, Since thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.
verses.ct: Even the cypress trees celebrate over you, along with the cedars of Lebanon, saying, 'Since you were brought down, no one comes to cut us down anymore.'

verses.kjv: Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming: it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.
verses.ct: The realm of the dead below is stirred up to greet you when you arrive. It rouses the spirits of the departed for you — all the former rulers of the earth. It lifts from their thrones every king of the nations.

verses.kjv: All they shall speak and say unto thee, Art thou also become weak as we? art thou become like unto us?
verses.ct: They will all speak up and say to you, 'So you've become as powerless as we are? You've ended up just like us?'

verses.kjv: Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.
verses.ct: Your splendor has been dragged down to the grave, along with the music of your harps. Maggots are your bed beneath you, and worms are your blanket.

verses.kjv: How art thou fallen from heaven, O Lucifer, son of the morning! how art thou cut down to the ground, which didst weaken the nations!
verses.ct: How you have fallen from heaven, O morning star, son of the dawn! How you have been thrown down to the ground, you who once brought nations to their knees!

verses.kjv: For thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God: I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north:
verses.ct: You said in your heart, 'I will climb up to heaven. I will raise my throne above the stars of God. I will take my seat on the mountain of assembly, on the far reaches of the north.'

verses.kjv: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the most High.
verses.ct: 'I will rise above the tops of the clouds. I will make myself equal to the Most High.'

verses.kjv: Yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the sides of the pit.
verses.ct: But instead, you are dragged down to the grave, to the deepest part of the pit.

verses.kjv: They that see thee shall narrowly look upon thee, and consider thee, saying, Is this the man that made the earth to tremble, that did shake kingdoms;
verses.ct: Those who see you will stare at you closely and think it over, saying, 'Is this really the man who made the earth tremble and shook kingdoms?'

verses.kjv: That made the world as a wilderness, and destroyed the cities thereof; that opened not the house of his prisoners?
verses.ct: 'Is this the one who turned the world into a wasteland, demolished its cities, and never released his prisoners to go home?'

verses.kjv: All the kings of the nations, even all of them, lie in glory, every one in his own house.
verses.ct: All the kings of the nations — every single one — rest in honor, each in his own tomb.

verses.kjv: But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and as the raiment of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcase trodden under feet.
verses.ct: But you are thrown out of your tomb like a disgusting branch, covered with the clothing of the killed — those pierced by the sword, thrown down among the stones of the pit, like a corpse trampled underfoot.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land, and slain thy people: the seed of evildoers shall never be renowned.
verses.ct: You will not join them in a proper burial, because you ruined your own land and killed your own people. The descendants of evildoers will never be remembered with honor.

verses.kjv: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the face of the world with cities.
verses.ct: Prepare a place of execution for his sons because of the sins of their fathers, so they will not rise up, take control of the land, or fill the surface of the earth with their cities.

verses.kjv: For I will rise up against them, saith the LORD of hosts, and cut off from Babylon the name, and remnant, and son, and nephew, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: 'I will rise up against them,' declares the LORD of hosts. 'I will eliminate from Babylon its name, its survivors, its children, and its descendants,' declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: 'I will turn it into a habitat for hedgehogs and into stagnant marshes. I will sweep it away with the broom of destruction,' declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts hath sworn, saying, Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts has made a solemn oath, saying, 'What I have planned will certainly happen, and what I have decided will stand firm —

verses.kjv: That I will break the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot: then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.
verses.ct: I will crush the Assyrian in my land and trample him on my mountains. Then his yoke will be removed from my people, and his burden will be lifted from their shoulders.'

verses.kjv: This is the purpose that is purposed upon the whole earth: and this is the hand that is stretched out upon all the nations.
verses.ct: This is the plan that has been determined for the entire earth, and this is the hand that is raised against all the nations.

verses.kjv: For the LORD of hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul it? and his hand is stretched out, and who shall turn it back?
verses.ct: When the LORD of hosts has made his decision, who can reverse it? When his hand is raised, who can push it back?

verses.kjv: In the year that king Ahaz died was this burden.
verses.ct: This message came in the year that King Ahaz died:

verses.kjv: Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that smote thee is broken: for out of the serpent’s root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.
verses.ct: Don't celebrate, all you people of Philistia, just because the rod that struck you is broken. From the snake's root a viper will emerge, and its offspring will be a darting, venomous serpent.

verses.kjv: And the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety: and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.
verses.ct: The poorest of the poor will find pasture, and those in need will rest in safety. But I will starve your roots with famine, and your survivors will be killed.

verses.kjv: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved: for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.
verses.ct: Wail at the gate! Cry out, O city! Melt in fear, all of Philistia! A cloud of smoke is coming from the north, and not a single soldier breaks rank in its formations.

verses.kjv: What shall one then answer the messengers of the nation? That the LORD hath founded Zion, and the poor of his people shall trust in it.
verses.ct: What answer will be given to the envoys of that nation? That the LORD has established Zion, and the afflicted among his people will find refuge there.
